abstract: The show draws 15.4 million viewers after a month of steep drops.
snippet: The show draws 15.4 million viewers after a month of steep drops.
lead_paragraph: After enduring a month of steep drops following its huge season-premiere numbers, "Two and a Half Men" on CBS finally changed course on Monday night, reaching 15.4 million total viewers and posting a 6 percent increase in the 18-to-49-year-old demographic compared to last week. ABC had the most viewers for the night over all thanks to "Dancing With the Stars," which averaged nearly 17 million total viewers over two hours.

headline.main: 'Two and a Half Men' Bounces Back
